location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Draft of a letter from Major David Wilson, Resident at Bushire, to Moola Hoossein, Agent at Sharga [Sharjah]

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: This item has two different foliation sequences. The first is part of an original foliation sequence which was applied to the whole volume. It is written in ink and appears at the top right (recto) or top left (verso) corner of the folio. The second foliation number is a small pencil number enclosed in a circle which also appears in the top right corner (recto) only, this is the foliation number that has been used in referencing this item.Condition: The item has suffered from slight insect damage, but this does not affect the reading of the text.

mods.abstract: The letter regards the Agents' purchase of a house, asks for further information on unfamiliar place neames and of former communications, a messenger of Toorkey bin Saeed [Turki bin Abdullah bin Muhammad Al Saâ€˜ud, founder of the Second Saudi State], and asks for further information on particular tribes, the restoration of boats belonging to the Sharga [Sharjah] people, other matters relating to Sultan bin Sugger [Sultan bin Saqr], various acts of piracy, and the peace between Sultan bin Sugger and Shaikh Tanoon [Tahnun bin Shakhbut Al Nahyan].
